allQuestions.resource: John carried out a survey to find out about the specifications of cars that some people owned

questions.questionText: Based on the diagram, which statement is true about all the cars that were owned by the people John interviewed?
questions.answerReasoning:
Set A always has three circles with tangents. Other shapes are irrelevant.
Set B always has two circles intersected by lines. Other shapes are irrelevant.
questions.answer: Some of the cars with parking sensors also have 2 doors.
questions.option1: Some of the cars with parking sensors also have 2 doors.
questions.option2: All of the cars with parking sensors have two doors
questions.option3: Some of the cars with leather seats have 2 doors
questions.option4: All of the cars have 2 doors

allQuestions.resource:
50 employees were asked about how they travelled to work each day. 
8 took the train only 
14 took the bus and the train

questions.questionText: If the number of employees that only walked or only took the bus was the same, how many employees only walked?
questions.answerReasoning:
Set A always has three circles with tangents. Other shapes are irrelevant.
Set B always has two circles intersected by lines. Other shapes are irrelevant.
